discourse_list.title: Celsius will probably be liquidated and the consequences for MakerDao

content.content: Do recent market events have an impact on MakerDao, e.g. Celsius was one of the big vault users, the market reacts to the fact that we are Celsius exposed. Celsius has stopped withdrawals. Do we have to suffer repercussions or does something have to be done with Celsius deals etc.? Or are they just “ordinary” vault users where Liq 2.0 just comes into play. Can the CUs who are in contact with Celsius and Nexo or worked with them please comment on this? Nexo seems to take over assets otc from Celsius, Celsius will probably be liquidated. These are cruel times, I hope the protocol comes out of the whole thing stronger, whatever else may come, this situation will probably throw out more market participants.

You can find their vaults here:    maker.blockanalitica.com   MakerDAO Risk Dashboard | Block Analitica MakerDAO Risk Dashboard from Block Analitica      WBTC-A is about 6% away from getting liquidated. We reached out to them earlier today and we were told they are monitoring the situation. Worse case if the 280m WBTC-A gets liquidated, the Maker liquidation system would start liquidating their vault in 40m DAI tranches every 30min (really depends on price trajectory), until the point where their collateralization improves - which might be all the way down to 280m liquidated. The outcome really depends on price trajectory and their ability to top-up collateral or repay in time. Note also that when you liquidate 40m on total debt of 280m you increase CR from 145% to about 150% if prices stay flat from last OSM update (assuming there’s also not a lot of slippage coming from keepers).
2,000 WBTC was just deposited and new liquidation price is $20,727

In this market phase we can still see this today, which would be disastrous, also if youre checking the liquidations on Liquidations the most of them are retail investors who cant pay huge fees to maintain the vaults. Celsius can probably manage them hopefully

twitter.com    Hsaka @HsakaTrades  Celsius continuing to top up collateral.  Liq at 18.3k now https://t.co/JgPB71J1KO   1:44 PM - 13 Jun 2022           1.6K                210            $18.3K is new liquidation price.

makercaesar:  Do we have to suffer repercussions or does something have to be done with Celsius deals etc.? Or are they just “ordinary” vault users where Liq 2.0 just comes into play.   Maker does not have any exposure through Celsius as an intermediary, or any intermediary for that matter. To the extent the protocol is exposed, it is to the potential loss in business from a longstanding customer should they get liquidated or cover and exit their positions.

Saludiego_201:  $18.3K is new liquidation price.   “steady lads deploying more capital”     adcv:  Maker does not have any exposure through Celsius as an intermediary, or any intermediary for that matter. To the extent the protocol is exposed, it is to the potential loss in business from a longstanding customer should they get liquidated or cover and exit their positions.   Thank you for clarifying, it’s hard to keep track of all the MIPs and how these affect the protocol in detail in different situations or whether institutional vaults might have already been implemented. Due to recent events, gave me cause for concern.
Well there is also the risk that Maker can’t liquidate 500 million WTBC at a reasonable price and we take a loss on the vault.
They added more collateral – new liquidation price is $16,852.37

CodeKnight:  Well there is also the risk that Maker can’t liquidate 500 million WTBC at a reasonable price and we take a loss on the vault.   With current market conditions 500 million of no crypto in spot settlements is positive.     Leritu:  They added more collateral – new liquidation price is $16,852.37   Thanks for the update.

Incredible that despite this hype with Celsius in danger of liquidation the CEL token has risen 325% since June 13, investors may think that the worst is over and therefore are still betting on Celsius that the market will recover, Celsius can pay its debts in profits and that event will be history, but it is very risky to think that way at this time.

As you point out @cryptenthusiastic, Celsius might be able to pay off its debts in the future but its prospects look bleak. The fact that at least some buyers are still willing to recklessly speculate on the CEL token seems like a sign to me that the bear market is a long way off being finished. There’s a lot of irrational exuberance that hasn’t been swept out to sea just yet.

If liquidation were to occur and Celsius was not able to repay the borrowed amount from the wBTC vault, wouldn’t there be an incentive for a third party to repay the loan to capture the 150% in collateral minus liquidation fee? Although other effects, such as downward pressure on crypto prices and headlines, are unknown what risks do you see to MakerDAO?
